intro: Rubus colemannii subsp. eriostachys, commonly known as the slender blackberry, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant taxonomy.
